headline.main: FROM THE UTAH ARMY.; The Weather--Proceedings in the Camp--Indictments for Treason--Miscellaneous. Later From the Military Expedition in Utah.

docs.lead_paragraph: The mail from the States has at length reached us in our exile, and the brow of care and anxiety is relaxed, the fatigue of military discipline and exposure is forgotten, and even the hollow mirth at the wine glass and the beart.corroding excitement of the gaming table are thrown off, and all hearts are softened with thoughts of home, of absent friends.
docs.abstract: List of the Mormons indicted for treason

headline.main: Important from Utah.; COL. JOHNSTON'S EFFECTIVE FORCE--DETERMINATION TO ATTACK SALT LAKE CITY, &C.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Utah man which left Camp Scott March l, has arrived. The troops continued in fine health, and were awaiting the determination of their Commander to proceed to Salt LaKe. Col. JOHNSTON had a regular effective force of 1,800 men, and a thousand animals in good condition, with a large volunteer force, and the general impression was that he would not wait for reinforcements before making the attack.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Indian, from Liverpool on the afternoon of the 24th ult., arrived at Portland yesterday, bringing four days' later intelligence from Europe. On the day previous to the Indian's departure, the United States steam-frigate Niagara arrived at Portsmouth with her machinery slightly damaged. She experienced a succession of heavy southerly gales during the passage out.

headline.main: INTERESTING FROM WASHINGTON.; Collector Schell Again at the Capital-The Willett's Point Affair-Final Passage of the Army Bill--The Command of the Utah Expedition-Contract for Colt's Arms-Lecompton, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Collector SCHELL has again been dragged from his duties at the receipt of Customs to attend to political and personal exigencies here. 1 understand that his case is looking brighter, in consequence of concessions made to the New-York Delegation, hitherto resisted, but involving the sacrifice of HORACE F CLARK and his numerous appointees in the CustomHouse-who may accordingly prepare for decapitation.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate last night adjourned at 1 1/4 o'clock, after having ordered a final vote to be taken on the Half-Dime bill on Monday evening at 8 o'clock, without debate. REPORTS. By Mr. DARLING, favorably, to authorize the State Engineer and Surveyor to call on railroads for extra reports, when in his judgment the interests of the State requires the same.

docs.lead_paragraph: Quarantine has been established for the season and arrangements have been made by the Health Officer to enforce the health laws rigidly. Since the first of April, all vessels arriving are subject to a visit of inspection. To assist the Health Officer, a police force has been detailed, which will be always on duty within the inclosure.

headline.main: THE MYSTERIOUS MURDER.; The Body of the Drowned Youth Identified the Father-Arrests on Suspicion.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Thursday afternoon about 2 o'clock a boatman, who follows the business of dragging for old rope, , while opposite the foot of Beekman-street, hauled up the body of a young man, which had evidently lain but a short time in the water. Attached ?? by a strong cord was a stone weighing some 50 pounds, which was ingeniously slung by places of bedord, part of hemp and part of manila.

headline.main: ONE DAY LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE HAMMONIA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Hammenia arrived at this port on Thursday night bringing London evening papers of the 20th. and London morning papers of the same day. Advices by this steamer are therefore one day later that those received by the Persia. Consols closed on Saturday at 2 P. M. at 96 7/8 for money, and 96 7/8@97 for the 8th April.
docs.abstract: Trial of the King of Delhi

docs.lead_paragraph: The Philadelphia Inquirer has the following concerning Mr. Edwin Forrest: "Mr. Forrest, some time since, made a professional visit to St. Louis, where he experienced the most signal success. Before his return home he was seized with an attack of inflammatory rheumatism, from which he has not yet fully recovered. He is now at his residence on Broad-street, in this city, and is gradually improving.
